latest_posts.name: Erick Chandra
latest_posts.cooked:
Welcome to the dev community! Both Paul and Alon’s explanations are spot on, I’ll just add a bit more detail in case it helps.

When people say Kaia is EVM-compatible, it means that Kaia supports the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM), the “engine” that runs smart contracts on Ethereum. Thanks to this, developers can use familiar tools, and even deploy existing Ethereum apps on Kaia with little to no changes.

So if you’re new to blockchain, EVM compatibility basically means you don’t have to learn a whole new system, a lot of what works on Ethereum will also work on Kaia.

For more details, you can check this out: https://www.coingecko.com/learn/ethereum-virtual-machine-evm

latest_posts.name: Lewis @Kaia
latest_posts.cooked:
Hi, thanks for your interest.

As you already know, Kaia has also been working to adopt the Pectra HF, and we’ll definitely bring the major EIPs in Pectra on Kaia!

Since there are design differences between Kaia vs Ethereum, there are also EIPs that we don’t need to bring; for example, blob-related things and EIP-7251. We don’t have the concept of MAX_EFFECTIVE_BALANCE for stakers, so there’ll be no EIP-7251 on Kaia. And also, EOF was originally expected to be included in Pectra but was delayed to Fusaka, and finally decided to be removed from Fusaka after discussion recently. So we also won’t bring EOF.

But EIP-7702, which is the key concept to explore the UX, will also be activated on Kaia after Kaia’s Prague HF.

If you have more questions, please let us know! Thanks for your support again.
latest_posts.topic_title: Pectra Improvements aligns with Kaia goal of scalability and UX. Will Kaia bridge Ethereum pectra upgrade?
latest_posts.topic_html_title: Pectra Improvements aligns with Kaia goal of scalability and UX. Will Kaia bridge Ethereum pectra upgrade?
latest_posts.raw:
Hi, thanks for your interest.

As you already know, Kaia has also been working to adopt the Pectra HF, and we'll definitely bring the major EIPs in Pectra on Kaia!

Since there are design differences between Kaia vs Ethereum, there are also EIPs that we don't need to bring; for example, blob-related things and EIP-7251. We don't have the concept of `MAX_EFFECTIVE_BALANCE` for stakers, so there'll be no EIP-7251 on Kaia. And also, EOF was originally expected to be included in Pectra but was delayed to Fusaka, and finally decided to be removed from Fusaka after discussion recently. So we also won't bring EOF.

But EIP-7702, which is the key concept to explore the UX, will also be activated on Kaia after Kaia's Prague HF.

If you have more questions, please let us know! Thanks for your support again.

latest_posts.cooked:
Bridging Ethereum’s Pectra Upgrade to Kaia: A Path Forward.

Introduction: Why Pectra Matters for Kaia.

The blockchain ecosystem is in a constant state of evolution, with Ethereum leading many of the most impactful upgrades. The upcoming Pectra upgrade, combining the Prague and Electra hard forks, introduces key improvements that could significantly benefit Kaia, an EVM-compatible blockchain focused on scalability and user experience.

As Ethereum rolls out account abstraction (EIP-7702), staking optimizations (EIP-7251), and EVM bytecode enhancements (EOF), Kaia has a unique opportunity to integrate these innovations—strengthening its infrastructure, attracting developers, and improving its consensus model. But how feasible is this integration? What challenges might arise? And what strategic steps should Kaia take to adopt these upgrades effectively?

This article explores the connections, risks, and strategies for bringing Ethereum’s Pectra advancements to Kaia.

Understanding Ethereum’s Pectra Upgrade

Key Features of Pectra

Pectra is one of Ethereum’s most anticipated upgrades, introducing several major improvements:

  1. EIP-7702 (Account Abstraction)
  • Allows externally owned accounts (EOAs) to delegate transactions to smart contracts.
  • Enables gasless transactions, batch operations, and sponsored transactions, improving UX for wallets and dApps.
  1. EIP-7251 (Increased Staking Limits)
  • Raises the maximum effective validator balance from 32 ETH to 2,048 ETH.
  • Reduces operational overhead for large stakers, improving capital efficiency.
  1. EVM Object Format (EOF)
  • Restructures EVM bytecode for better security, upgradability, and gas efficiency.
  • Reduces risks like reentrancy attacks while optimizing smart contract execution.

How Pectra Enhances Ethereum

  • Scalability: EOF and EIP-7702 help reduce on-chain congestion.
  • Security: More robust smart contract execution and validator management.
  • User Experience: Smoonder DeFi, gaming, and wallet interactions.

Kaia’s Current Ecosystem: Strengths and Alignment with Ethereum

Kaia’s Technical Foundation

  • EVM Compatibility: Full support for Ethereum tools (MetaMask, Hardhat, Foundry).
  • Consensus Mechanism: Hybrid PoS with high throughput (~4,000 TPS).
  • Use Cases: Strong adoption in DeFi, gaming, and enterprise blockchain solutions.

Why Pectra’s Upgrades Are Relevant for Kaia

Since Kaia is EVM-compatible, Ethereum’s upgrades naturally influence its roadmap. Key areas of alignment include:

  • Interoperability: Adopting similar EIPs ensures seamless dApp migration.
  • Staking Efficiency: EIP-7251 could optimize Kaia’s PoS model.
  • Developer Appeal: Features like account abstraction attract Ethereum developers.

Opportunities for Kaia: How Pectra Can Enhance the Ecosystem

  1. Better EVM Compatibility with EOF
  • Improves smart contract security and efficiency.
  • Ensures Kaia remains competitive with Ethereum’s latest optimizations.
  1. Account Abstraction (EIP-7702) for Superior UX
  • Gasless transactions (sponsored by dApps or wallets).
  • Batch transactions (e.g., approving and swapping tokens in one click).
  • Enhanced wallet security (social recovery, multi-signature schemes).
  1. Staking Improvements via EIP-7251
  • Allows validators to consolidate stakes, reducing node management complexity.
  • Could attract institutional stakers to Kaia’s network.

Challenges and Risks in Integration

  1. Technical Hurdles
  • EOF Adoption: Requires deep bytecode-level changes in Kaia’s EVM.
  • Consensus Adjustments: EIP-7251 may need modifications for Kaia’s PoS model.
  1. Security Considerations
  • EIP-7702 Risks: Malicious invokers could exploit transaction delegation.
  • Governance Complexity: Deciding which EIPs to prioritize without disrupting stability.
  1. Developer and Community Buy-In
  • Requires education, tooling updates, and governance proposals (KIPs).
  • Potential resistance from validators if staking changes affect rewards.

Strategic Recommendations for Kaia

  1. Phased Rollout of Pectra EIPs.
  • Short-Term: Implement EIP-7702 for immediate UX benefits.
  • Medium-Term: Adopt EOF for smarter contract execution.
  • Long-Term: Evaluate EIP-7251 for staking optimizations.
  1. Strengthening Cross-Chain Bridges
  • Improve Klaytn ↔ Ethereum bridges (e.g., Orbit, Axelar) for smoother asset and data flow.
  1. Developer Incentives and Governance
  • Host workshops on Pectra EIPs for Kaia developers.
  • Propose KIPs (Kaia Improvement Proposals) to formalize upgrade paths.

Conclusion: Positioning Kaia for the Future

Ethereum’s Pectra upgrade presents a golden opportunity for Kaia to enhance its scalability, security, and user experience while maintaining strong EVM compatibility. By selectively adopting EIP-7702, EOF, and EIP-7251, Kaia can attract more developers, improve validator efficiency, and offer a superior blockchain experience.

However, careful governance, risk assessment, and community engagement will be crucial for a smooth transition. If executed well, Kaia could emerge as a leading high-performance EVM chain—bridging the best of Ethereum’s innovations with its own unique strengths.

latest_posts.raw:
Bridging Ethereum’s Pectra Upgrade to Kaia: A Path Forward.

Introduction: Why Pectra Matters for Kaia.

The blockchain ecosystem is in a constant state of evolution, with Ethereum leading many of the most impactful upgrades. The upcoming Pectra upgrade, combining the Prague and Electra hard forks, introduces key improvements that could significantly benefit Kaia, an EVM-compatible blockchain focused on scalability and user experience.

As Ethereum rolls out account abstraction (EIP-7702), staking optimizations (EIP-7251), and EVM bytecode enhancements (EOF), Kaia has a unique opportunity to integrate these innovations—strengthening its infrastructure, attracting developers, and improving its consensus model. But how feasible is this integration? What challenges might arise? And what strategic steps should Kaia take to adopt these upgrades effectively?

This article explores the connections, risks, and strategies for bringing Ethereum’s Pectra advancements to Kaia.

---

Understanding Ethereum’s Pectra Upgrade

Key Features of Pectra

Pectra is one of Ethereum’s most anticipated upgrades, introducing several major improvements:

1. EIP-7702 (Account Abstraction)
  * Allows externally owned accounts (EOAs) to delegate transactions to smart contracts.
  * Enables gasless transactions, batch operations, and sponsored transactions, improving UX for wallets and dApps.
2. EIP-7251 (Increased Staking Limits)
  * Raises the maximum effective validator balance from 32 ETH to 2,048 ETH.
  * Reduces operational overhead for large stakers, improving capital efficiency.
3. EVM Object Format (EOF)
  * Restructures EVM bytecode for better security, upgradability, and gas efficiency.
  * Reduces risks like reentrancy attacks while optimizing smart contract execution.

How Pectra Enhances Ethereum

* Scalability: EOF and EIP-7702 help reduce on-chain congestion.
* Security: More robust smart contract execution and validator management.
* User Experience: Smoonder DeFi, gaming, and wallet interactions.

---

Kaia’s Current Ecosystem: Strengths and Alignment with Ethereum

Kaia’s Technical Foundation

* EVM Compatibility: Full support for Ethereum tools (MetaMask, Hardhat, Foundry).
* Consensus Mechanism: Hybrid PoS with high throughput (~4,000 TPS).
* Use Cases: Strong adoption in DeFi, gaming, and enterprise blockchain solutions.

Why Pectra’s Upgrades Are Relevant for Kaia

Since Kaia is EVM-compatible, Ethereum’s upgrades naturally influence its roadmap. Key areas of alignment include:

* Interoperability: Adopting similar EIPs ensures seamless dApp migration.
* Staking Efficiency: EIP-7251 could optimize Kaia’s PoS model.
* Developer Appeal: Features like account abstraction attract Ethereum developers.

---

Opportunities for Kaia: How Pectra Can Enhance the Ecosystem

1. Better EVM Compatibility with EOF

* Improves smart contract security and efficiency.
* Ensures Kaia remains competitive with Ethereum’s latest optimizations.

2. Account Abstraction (EIP-7702) for Superior UX

* Gasless transactions (sponsored by dApps or wallets).
* Batch transactions (e.g., approving and swapping tokens in one click).
* Enhanced wallet security (social recovery, multi-signature schemes).

3. Staking Improvements via EIP-7251

* Allows validators to consolidate stakes, reducing node management complexity.
* Could attract institutional stakers to Kaia’s network.

---

Challenges and Risks in Integration

1. Technical Hurdles

* EOF Adoption: Requires deep bytecode-level changes in Kaia’s EVM.
* Consensus Adjustments: EIP-7251 may need modifications for Kaia’s PoS model.

2. Security Considerations

* EIP-7702 Risks: Malicious invokers could exploit transaction delegation.
* Governance Complexity: Deciding which EIPs to prioritize without disrupting stability.

3. Developer and Community Buy-In

* Requires education, tooling updates, and governance proposals (KIPs).
* Potential resistance from validators if staking changes affect rewards.

---

Strategic Recommendations for Kaia

1. Phased Rollout of Pectra EIPs.

* Short-Term: Implement EIP-7702 for immediate UX benefits.
* Medium-Term: Adopt EOF for smarter contract execution.
* Long-Term: Evaluate EIP-7251 for staking optimizations.

2. Strengthening Cross-Chain Bridges

* Improve Klaytn ↔ Ethereum bridges (e.g., Orbit, Axelar) for smoother asset and data flow.

3. Developer Incentives and Governance

* Host workshops on Pectra EIPs for Kaia developers.
* Propose KIPs (Kaia Improvement Proposals) to formalize upgrade paths.

---

Conclusion: Positioning Kaia for the Future

Ethereum’s Pectra upgrade presents a golden opportunity for Kaia to enhance its scalability, security, and user experience while maintaining strong EVM compatibility. By selectively adopting EIP-7702, EOF, and EIP-7251, Kaia can attract more developers, improve validator efficiency, and offer a superior blockchain experience.

However, careful governance, risk assessment, and community engagement will be crucial for a smooth transition. If executed well, Kaia could emerge as a leading high-performance EVM chain—bridging the best of Ethereum’s innovations with its own unique strengths.

latest_posts.name: Lewis @Kaia
latest_posts.cooked:
안녕하세요, 먼저 state migration 는 Live pruning과는 다른 방식입니다. 자세한 내용은 여기서 확인하실 수 있습니다.

Live pruning시 지연은 지금까지 리포트된 것이 없어서 일반적이진 않은 것 같습니다. 아무래도 실시간으로 retention이 지난 노드를 삭제하고 트래킹해야하기 때문에 기존보단 메모리 사용량이 늘긴하겠지만 1초 지연이 발생할 정도는 아닐 것 같은데요, 현재 카이아의 네트워크 트래픽이 크게 증가한 상황이라 그럴 수도 있을 것 같습니다.

네, 현재 Live pruning은 state migration 스냅샷 데이터와 비교했을 때 500GB정도 차이가 나는 것으로 확인됩니다.

저희도 최근 늘어난 트래픽으로 인해 필요한 disk size가 빠르게 증가하는 것을 확인하였고, 이를 위한 해결책을 준비중에 있습니다. 특히 full node의 경우 곧 storage compression이 도입되어 state migration 기준 ~57%의 disk size를 줄일 수 있는 기능이 도입될 예정이며, archive node의 경우는 state trie의 사이즈를 줄일 수 있는 여러 방법론들을 검토 중에 있습니다.

감사합니다.

저희도 최근 늘어난 트래픽으로 인해 필요한 disk size가 빠르게 증가하는 것을 확인하였고, 이를 위한 해결책을 준비중에 있습니다. 특히 full node의 경우 곧 [storage compression이](https://kips.kaia.io/KIPs/kip-237) 도입되어 state migration 기준 ~57%의 disk size를 줄일 수 있는 기능이 도입될 예정이며, archive node의 경우는 state trie의 사이즈를 줄일 수 있는 여러 방법론들을 검토 중에 있습니다.

latest_posts.name: cleo arb
latest_posts.cooked:
안녕하세요.

개인적으로 EN을 운영하고 있는데 스토리지로 인해 비용에 부담을 느끼고 있습니다. 이에 프루닝에 대해 알게되었는데 관련 문의 드립니다.

1. State Batch Pruning (State Migration)
이를 활용하면 스토리지를 75% 정도 줄일 수 있다는 아티클을 봤습니다.
카이아 측에서 주기적으로 제공하는 체인데이터 스냅샷은 이게 이미 적용된거라고 보면 될까요?
압축 해제 시 약 5.2TB가 나오는데 여기서 더 줄일 수 있는지 궁금합니다.

2. Live Pruning
라이브 프루닝을 적용해봤더니 기존에 돌리던 것 대비 약 1초 지연이 되는 것을 확인했습니다.
라이브 프루닝 적용 시 이 정도 지연이 일반적인지 궁금합니다.
또한 라이브 프루닝의 경우 압축 해제 시 4.7TB인데 1번 대비 500GB 차이나는게 맞을까요?

스토리지 비용이 점점 늘어나서 고민이 많습니다 ㅠㅠ

감사합니다.

Like real-world adoption starts with solving real problems—whether it's in DeFi, GameFi, identity, social impact, supply chain, or something unique to your region or interest.

Feel free to:

* Share any problems you think Web3 can help solve.
* Post ideas you’ve been thinking of building.
* Ask for feedback or collaborators.

Let’s use this space to **create and support innovative ideas** that show what KAIA can really do!~~ (just share anything will do :wink:)

latest_posts.name: Erick Chandra
latest_posts.cooked:
Kaia Square에는 큰 금액을 클레임하는 것을 막는 규칙이 없습니다. 7일 쿨다운이 끝난 후에도 Claim 버튼이 회색으로 남아 있다면, 보통 프론트엔드 오류입니다. 페이지를 새로고침하고 지갑을 다시 연결해 주세요.

“언스테이킹 진행” 카드에서 확인해 주세요:

  • Claimable이 0 KAIA로 표시된다면, 타이머가 아직 완료되지 않은 것이므로 버튼이 계속 회색으로 표시됩니다.
  • 7일 이상 기다렸는데도 문제가 계속된다면, Kaia Discord(Kaia)에서 지원 티켓을 열어주시면 팀에서 도와드리겠습니다.

감사합니다^^

[EN]
Hi, There isn’t any rule in Kaia Square that blocks a large claim.
If the Claim button is still grey after the 7-day cool-down, it’s usually a front-end glitch. Please refresh the page and reconnect your wallet.

Check the “undelegation progress” card:

  • If it shows Claimable 0 KAIA, the timer hasn’t finished yet, so the button will stay grey.
  • If you’ve already waited more than 7 days and the problem persists, open a support ticket in the Kaia Discord (Kaia) and our team will help you there.

Thank You^^

latest_posts.name: ian song
latest_posts.cooked:
what happens if like a transaction fails? How will wallets add this feature?

Great question. The receipts of reverting gasless transactions will not be found after some time (10~30s). The wallet will wait for receipts and know the transaction failed if they are not found. It is different from when a normal transaction reverts in that the receipt of the reverted transaction can be found.

latest_posts.name: ian song
latest_posts.cooked:
Good question. If any of the gasless transactions (approve or swap) reverts, then none of the transactions will be included in the block, so it’ll be like the transactions were never sent.
For example, given txs = [ A1 S1 A2 S2 A3 S3 ] (Approve and Swap txs for user 1-3), If S2 reverts, then block will include only [ A1 S1 A3 S3 ].
This is enforced by KIP-245; reverting txs in bundle will be excluded from block.
Note that KIP-245 does not “simulate” the transaction execution; it is difficult to predict if a tx will revert. Instead, transactions in a bundle are actually executed, and rolled-back to pre-execution upon revert.
